snippet: Mark Penn made a name for himself in Washington by bulldozing enemies of the Clintons. Now he’s trying to do the same to Google, on behalf of its rival Microsoft.
abstract: Mark Penn, longtime political operative who earned recognition bulldozing the enemies of the Clinton family, is now in charge of 'strategic and special projects' at Microsoft; has created several advertisements and campaigns that are aimed at hurting Google, which Microsoft has so far failed to dislodge from its perch atop the lucrative Internet search market.

byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER
byline.contributor: Nick Wingfield reported from Seattle and Claire Cain Miller from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: Mark Penn made a name for himself in Washington by bulldozing enemies of the Clintons. Now he’s trying to do the same to Google, on behalf of its rival Microsoft.

headline.seo: Microsoft Battles Google by Hiring Political Brawler Mark Penn
headline.main: A Political Brawler, Now Battling for Microsoft
headline.print_headline: A Political Brawler, Now Battling for Microsoft
